name: RI_1_1_2_1_Evidence_of_Record_Entry_Amendment_Event
title: RI.1.1.2.1 Evidence of Record Entry Amendment Event (Function)
description: Maintain Evidence of Record Entry Amendment Event
purpose: Evidence of Record Entry Amendment Event includes key metadata, ensures health record integrity (and trust) and enables record audit.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL audit each occurrence when a Record Entry is amended.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#02
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the organization where Record Entry content is amended.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#03
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the patient who is subject of amended Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the user who entered/authored Record Entry content amendment.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#05
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture identity of the system application which amended Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#06
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the type of Record Event trigger (i.e., amendment).

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#07
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture the date and time Record Entry content is amended.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#08
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture identity of the location (i.e., network address) where Record Entry content is amended.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#09
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture the rationale for amending Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#10
statement.requirement: The system SHALL capture a sequence identifier for amended Record Entry content.

statement.label: RI.1.1.2.1#11
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD capture a reference (e.g., link, pointer) to pre-amendment data for each amended Record Entry.
